name: v2.8.0
body:
First release being [fully compatible with AEMaaCS](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues/566). There are two flavors of the tool now: Classic (on Prem/AMS) and Cloud (AEMaaCS).
Make sure to use the correct one (with or without classifier `cloud`).

For a full list have a look at https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.8.0

The released packages are available via Maven Central:
[accesscontroltool-package-2.8.0](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.8.0/accesscontroltool-package-2.8.0.zip)

name: v2.7.1
body:
Maintenance release with enhancements, in particular

* #503 Improves performance of authorizables installation significantly for some setups
* #523 Allows to limit what yaml files are taken for installation by install hook via regex

For a full list have a look at https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.7.1

The released packages are available via Maven Central:
[accesscontroltool-package-2.7.1](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.7.1/accesscontroltool-package-2.7.1.zip)
[accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.7.1](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package/2.7.1/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.7.1.zip)
[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.7.1](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/2.7.1/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.7.1.zip)

This release introduces [interpolation support for YAML values](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/develop/docs/AdvancedFeatures.md#interpolate-values). In addition the release does no longer embed Bouncy Castle because there are now better ways, on how to [encrypt a private key](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/develop/docs/Configuration.md#configuration-of-keys). If you still need Bouncy Castle you need to [install it in addition](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/develop/docs/Configuration.md#install-bouncy-castle).

For details look at https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.7.0

The released packages are available via Maven Central:
[accesscontroltool-package-2.7.0](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.7.0/accesscontroltool-package-2.7.0.zip)
[accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.7.0](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package/2.7.0/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.7.0.zip)
[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.7.0](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/2.7.0/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.7.0.zip)

name: v2.6.0
body:
This release includes features (particular around variables handling) and bugfixes:

**New Features:**
* Allow variables with arbitrary yaml list/map structures #489
* Allow to reuse variables from other YAML files #257
* Provide impersonation configuration #455 

For details look at https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.6.0

The released packages are available via Maven Central:
[accesscontroltool-package-2.6.0](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.6.0/accesscontroltool-package-2.6.0.zip)

This release fixes one issue with regards to user key deployment

For details look at https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.5.5

The released packages are available via Maven Central:
[accesscontroltool-package-2.5.5](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.5.5/accesscontroltool-package-2.5.5.zip)

body:
This release introduces [support for negated run modes](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues/469) and [better handling of user keystores](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues/473). It also fixes some regressions of version 2.5.x.

For details look at https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.5.4

The released packages are available via Maven Central:

name: v2.5.1
body:
Release with improvements to make the AC Tool work better with [AEM as a Cloud Service](https://www.adobe.com/marketing/experience-manager/cloud-service.html) after [2.5.0](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/releases/tag/2.5.0) was the first one to officially support it. In particular this release makes the runmodes `dev`, `stage`, `prod` available in at runtime in the cloud (#421)

See https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.5.1 for a full list of what's in the release.

The released packages are available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-2.5.1](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.5.1/accesscontroltool-package-2.5.1.zip)

name: v2.5.0
body:
This release makes the AC Tool fit for Sling Feature Model based deployments in the cloud (see [Startup Hook](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/develop/docs/ApplyConfig.md#startup-hook)) and supports Adobe IO better by making a user's key store configurable (see [documentation](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/develop/docs/Configuration.md#configuration-of-keys)).

**New Features:**
* #405 Support running the AC Tool automatically upon server start 
* #410 Allow to configure multiple configuration root paths
* #402 Create user interface in Touch UI
* #387 Support creating keystores for users 

Apart from that, there are also some bugfixes and enhancements. See https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.5.0 for a full list of what's in the release.

The released packages are available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-2.5.0](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.5.0/accesscontroltool-package-2.5.0.zip)
[accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.5.0](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package/2.5.0/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.5.0.zip)
[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.5.0](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/2.5.0/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.5.0.zip)

name: v2.4.1
body:
**Improvements:**
* #287 Allow to run AC Tool in phase "INSTALLED" rather than "PREPARE" 
* #364 Allow for commas in group name 
* #386 Most installations will now be able to deal without the oak index (only really large instances will benefit)
* #370 Ignore trailing slashes for same path definitions 

Apart from that, there are also some bugfixes. See https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.4.1 for a full list of what's in the release.

The released packages is available via maven central:

name: v.2.3.1
body:
**NEW FEATURES:**
* #348 The AC Tool is now supported to run on **Apache Sling** (AEM features like `actions` definition or encrypted passwords are not available in Sling) 
* #350  There is a new **Felix Web Console Plugin** that is more comfortable than using JMX, especially when testing changes to config files directly in CRXDE locally

Apart from that, there are also some bugfixes. See https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.3.1 for a full list of what's in the release.

The released packages is available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-2.3.1](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.3.1/accesscontroltool-package-2.3.1.zip)

[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.3.1](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/2.3.1/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.3.1.zip)

name: v2.2.0
body:
**NEW FEATURES:**
* AC Tool does not have to be pre-installed during initial installation anymore! With #210 implemented, both AC Tool and YAML files can be sub packages within a complete package and linked with a package dependency to ensure installation order is correct.
* The variable `RUNMODES` is now pre-populated and it can be checked with e.g. `containsItem(RUNMODES, 'runmode')` in `IF` clauses #312 #311
* Password is now optional for regular users to allow for certain IdP setup scenarios #335

Apart from that, also the build setup has been improved (using bnd plugin #324) and we moved away from jgitflow #323. Also quite a few bugs have been fixed, see https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.2.0 for a full list of what's in the release.

The released packages is available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-2.2.0](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.2.0/accesscontroltool-package-2.2.0.zip)

name: v2.0.0
body:
We are pleased to announce version 2.0.0 with the following new features and improvements:

* **AEM 6.3 compatibility** (system user `actool-service` is now used to apply the configuration)
   * CQ 5.6.1 and AEM 6.0 compatibility has been dropped
* **ACLs** in content are now **updated incrementally** #155
   * 50% performance gain on execution time (particularly noticeable on large instances)
   * "Feels safer" as changes are only applied if necessary (verbose log clearly states what has been applied). See e.g. #126 for this 
* **New API** package `biz.netcentric.cq.tools.actool.api` for programmatic calls to AC Tool
   * use of semantic versioning and cleaned up interfaces
   * it is now possible to explicitly provide a configuration root path #156
   * old services (in particular `biz.netcentric.cq.tools.actool.aceservice.AceService`) are still available but are deprecated
* **Repository level ACLs** are now supported #137 
* Generally the AC Tool now uses exactly one session per update and the rollback mechanism has been removed #179 (instead of two sessions, one for authorizables and one for ACLs, this is not necessary with 6.x versions of AEM)
   
... and further bug fixes, full list of changes: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:2.0.0

The released packages is available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-2.0.0](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/2.0.0/accesscontroltool-package-2.0.0.zip)
[accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.0.0](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package/2.0.0/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-2.0.0.zip)
[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.0.0](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/2.0.0/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-2.0.0.zip)

name: v1.9.3
body:
- #140 It is now possible to specify an `externalId` for external IDP providers (LDAP being the typical example). This has become necessary because since oak 1.4.7 the external authentication provider ignores pre-created groups that do not have the correct `externalId` property set, see [comment in OAK-4397](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OAK-4397?focusedCommentId=15556027&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15556027) for further explanations and [Configuration of Groups](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/develop/docs/Configuration.md#configuration-of-groups) for documentation
- #153 To avoid duplication in yaml files it is now possible to set variables in yaml files (after `FOR` and `IF` we now have `DEF`)

... and further bug fixes, full list of changes: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:1.9.3

The released packages is available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-1.9.3](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/1.9.3/accesscontroltool-package-1.9.3.zip)
[accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-1.9.3](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package/1.9.3/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-1.9.3.zip)
[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-1.9.3](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/1.9.3/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-1.9.3.zip)

- New method to only apply ACLs to a list of given root paths (and leave rest of repository untouched for ACLs) #127
- An option to use intermediate saves to circumvent [OAK-5557](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OAK-5557):  [Documentation](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/1.9.2/docs/AdvancedFeatures.md#intermediate-save-calls-during-acl-installation), see  #149 and #147. Also see #145

... and further bug fixes, full list of changes: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:1.9.2

The released packages is available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-1.9.2](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/1.9.2/accesscontroltool-package-1.9.2.zip)
[accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-1.9.2](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package/1.9.2/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-1.9.2.zip)
[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-1.9.2](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/1.9.2/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-1.9.2.zip)

name: v1.9.1
body:
Amongst bug fixes, the following features have been implemented:
- A [mechanism to purge obsolete groups](docs/AdvancedFeatures.md#automatically-purge-obsolete-groups-and-users-since-191) (both the groups themselves and all ACEs linking those groups) #110
- A [Sling Health Check](docs/AdvancedFeatures.md#health-check-since-191) that warns in case last AC Tool installation resulted in error #105
- The properties `initialContent`, `preferencesContent` and `profileContent` support enhanced doc view format now #112
- It is possible to control the order of deny-ACEs for [special use cases](docs/AdvancedFeatures.md#use-manual-acl-ordering-since-191) now (e.g. useful when using [Sling Oak Restrictions](https://sling.apache.org/documentation/bundles/sling-oak-restrictions.html))  #123 

Full list of changes: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:1.9.1

The released packages is available via maven central: 
[accesscontroltool-package-1.9.1](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/1.9.1/accesscontroltool-package-1.9.1.zip)
[accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-1.9.1](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package/1.9.1/accesscontroltool-oakindex-package-1.9.1.zip)
[accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-1.9.1](http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package/1.9.1/accesscontroltool-exampleconfig-package-1.9.1.zip)

name: v1.9.0
body:
The AC Tool now supports arbitrary oak restrictions (#36), see [documentation](https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/blob/develop/docs/Configuration.md#configuration-of-aces) for details. 

Full list: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:1.9.0

The released package is available via maven central at http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/1.9.0/accesscontroltool-package-1.9.0.zip

name: v1.8.5
body:
- Introduced global configuration section "global_config" to allow to 
  - configure referenceable exernal groups #99 
  - and a minimum version #40 

Full list: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:1.8.5

The released package is available via maven central at http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/1.8.5/accesscontroltool-package-1.8.5.zip

name: v1.8.4
body:
- Improved logging #85 #87
- When using the install hook, the history is now also persisted in /var/statistics/achistory/ #86
- Bugfixes

Full list: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone:1.8.4

The released package is available via maven central at http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/1.8.4/accesscontroltool-package-1.8.4.zip

name: v1.8.3
body:
Compatibility with AEM 6.2

For details see https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?q=milestone%3A1.8.3

The released package is available via maven central at http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/biz/netcentric/cq/tools/accesscontroltool/accesscontroltool-package/1.8.3/accesscontroltool-package-1.8.3.zip

name: v1.8.2
body:
**New features:**
- Allow to set ACEs for anonymous user on publish #74 
- Allow to set profile and preferences data for authorizables #71 

Bugfixes and improvements, see 
https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A1.8.2+ for a full list

name: v1.8.1
body: Bugfix release issues #60 and #61

name: v1.8.0
body:
- Support for dynamic loops derived from the content structure, see https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool#loops-derived-from-content-structure-since-18x and #58 
- Improvements to oak index package
- Restored CQ 5.6.1 compatibility

For more details see https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=+milestone%3A1.8.0+

name: v1.7.0
body:
Allow to create non-existing paths (https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues/46)
JMX Entry path is now `biz.netcentric.cq.tools:type=ACTool` (https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues/50)
Allow to change group names of existing groups (https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues/44)
Several bugfixes

Changelog: https://github.com/Netcentric/accesscontroltool/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aclosed+milestone%3A1.7.0+

First version being compatible with AEM 6.1.

name: v1.5
body: Bugfix release.
Fixed a problem that caused problems with groups that are not part of the ACL config file.
